place.name: CREETON
place.gazetteerText: CREETON, a parish in Bourn district, Lincoln; on the river Glen and the Great Northern railway, 2 miles NNW of Little Bytham r. station, and 5¼ W of Bourn. Post town, Castle Bytham, under Stamford. Acres, 1, 003. Real property, £1, 018. Pop., 79. Houses, 15. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £161.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is very good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
